ore:describes.Title: Data for Chiming In: Social Presence in an International Multisite Blended Learning Course

citation:Description.dsDescription:Text: These are WhatsApp mobile instant messaging chats between refugee and non-refugee learners in one 2018 summer term York University undergraduate course offered through the Borderless Higher Education for Refugees Program. The learners are attributed to a country of location while studying, a gender, a final grade, and a chat group which was composed for the purposes of supporting a group presentation. Refugee learners were based in Kenya and Thailand, while none refugees were based in Canada. More learners were in the groups than were participants in the study. Non-participants' data and chats were removed from the groups. The chat messages are attributed to a learner, a date and time, and then coded for the indicators of social presence as described by the Community of Inquiry Framework.

ore:describes.Subject: Social Sciences

Related Publication.Citation: MacIsaac, P. L. (2021). Chiming In: Social presence in an international multi-site blended learning course (Doctoral dissertation, Athabasca University). http://hdl.handle.net/10791/348
